questions.question: In the context of Deterministic Finite Automaton (DFA), what is the purpose of minimization?

answers.a: To increase the number of states for better recognition.
answers.b: To simplify and reduce the number of states while preserving the language accepted.
answers.c: To add more transitions for increased complexity.
answers.d: To convert DFA to NFA for easier analysis.

explanations.b: Correct! Minimization of DFA is done to simplify and reduce the number of states while preserving the language accepted.

questions.question: What is the impact of minimization on the size of a Deterministic Finite Automaton (DFA)?

answers.a: It always increases the size of the DFA.
answers.b: It reduces the size of the DFA by eliminating redundant states.
answers.c: It has no effect on the size of the DFA.
answers.d: It only affects the transition functions of the DFA.

explanations.b: Correct! Minimization reduces the size of the DFA by eliminating redundant states while preserving the language.

questions.question: When is a Deterministic Finite Automaton (DFA) considered minimized?

answers.a: When it has the maximum number of states.
answers.b: When it recognizes a regular language.
answers.c: When no equivalent DFA with fewer states can recognize the same language.
answers.d: When it contains only one state.

explanations.c: Correct! A DFA is considered minimized when no equivalent DFA with fewer states can recognize the same language.
